Sentencas: Cerium oxide (ceria, CeO2-x) has been traditionally used as a catalyst support functionalized with metal nanoparticles or synthesized with metal dopants for a variety of applications ranging from catalytic converters to solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Cooperation of cerium oxide nanoparticles and soluble molecular catalysts for alcohol oxidation

Sentencas: In a departure from these typical heterogeneous motifs, we explore the interactions of nano-CeO2-x systems with organometallic oxidation catalysts in organic solvents.
Titulo: Cooperation of cerium oxide nanoparticles and soluble molecular catalysts for alcohol oxidation

Sentencas: Ceria is used here both as an organically-capped colloid and as an uncapped insoluble nanopowder.
Titulo: Cooperation of cerium oxide nanoparticles and soluble molecular catalysts for alcohol oxidation

Sentencas: Both the colloid and nanopowder act as terminal oxidants by accepting hydrogen atoms from a ruthenium Noyori-Ikariya hydride complex.
Titulo: Cooperation of cerium oxide nanoparticles and soluble molecular catalysts for alcohol oxidation

Sentencas: To our knowledge, this is the first demonstration that CeO2-x can oxidize an organometallic hydride.
Titulo: Cooperation of cerium oxide nanoparticles and soluble molecular catalysts for alcohol oxidation

Sentencas: Building on this concept, we show the uncapped CeO2-x powder also acts as the terminal acceptor in catalytic alcohol dehydrogenation reactions, utilizing iridium pyridine sulfonamide catalysts under anaerobic and aerobic conditions.
Titulo: Cooperation of cerium oxide nanoparticles and soluble molecular catalysts for alcohol oxidation

Sentencas: The coupling of homogeneous oxidation catalysts with cerium oxide demonstrates the versatility of CeO2-x and a bridging of concepts in homogeneous and heterogeneous catalysis.
Titulo: Cooperation of cerium oxide nanoparticles and soluble molecular catalysts for alcohol oxidation
